data.name: Length
data.comment: Number of chars in the string

data.name: Chars
data.comment: Array of Unicode chars (length given in bytes)

define_struct.comment: XXX THIS IS NOT YET COMPLETE

eval.comment: This is used later to calculate the address of the export table in the file.
This is used later to calculate the address of the import table in the file.
This is used later to calculate the address of the resource table in the file.
This is used later to calculate the address of the CLI table in the file.

data.name: e_cblp
data.comment: Bytes on last page of the file

data.name: e_cp
data.comment: Number of pages in the file

data.name: e_lfanew
data.comment: File address of the PE header

data.name: Signature
data.comment: The characters PE (for portable executeable) followed by 2 null bytes.

data.name: Machine
data.domain: {UNKNOWN, iAPX386=332, iAPX486, Pentium, MIPS1= 354, MIPS2, MIPS3, ALPHA=388, Intel64=512, AMD64_K8=0x8664 }
data.comment: What sort of processor instructions are in the code sections

data.name: TimeDateStamp
data.comment: When the linker built this file.

struct.name: NT_opthdr
struct.comment: Entry point relative to image base

data.name: image_base
data.comment: Virtual address of 1st byte of the file (64K multiple)

data.name: sect_align
data.comment: Must be power of 2 between 2^9 and 2^28)

data.name: file_align
data.comment: Must be power of 2 between 2^9 and 2^16)

data.name: image_size
data.comment: Total size including headers (must be multiple of sect_align)

data.name: header_size
data.comment: Size of DOS hdr, PE hdr and sector table.

data.name: checksum
data.comment: May be zero if not set.

data.name: va_count
data.comment: No of data dirs (ie size of following array)

struct.name: data_dir
struct.expr: dir_no == 0 ? "EXPORT Table" : (dir_no == 1 ? "IMPORT Table" : (dir_no == 2 ? "RESOURCE Table" : (dir_no == 3 ? "EXCEPTION Table" : (dir_no == 4 ? "SECURITY Table" : (dir_no == 5 ? "BASE RELOCATION Table" : (dir_no == 6 ? "DEBUG Directory" : (dir_no == 7 ? "Architecture Specific Data" : (dir_no == 8 ? "GLOBAL POINTER Register" : (dir_no == 9 ? "TLS Table" : (dir_no == 10 ? "LOAD CONFIG Table" : (dir_no == 11 ? "BOUND IMPORT Table" : (dir_no == 12 ? "IMPORT Address Table" : (dir_no == 13 ? "DELAY IMPORT Descriptor" : (dir_no == 14 ? "CLI Header" : "Unknown"))))))))))))));%s

data.name: name
data.comment: length is always 8 - given by: #define IMAGE_SIZEOF_SHORT_NAME 8

data.name: virt_size
data.comment: physical address OR virtual size (not used?)

data.name: RVA
data.comment: Relative Virtual Address. The virtual address the object is currently relocated to, relative to the Image Base.

data.name: ALIGN
data.domain: {DEFAULT16, ALIGN1, ALIGN2, ALIGN4, ALIGN8, ALIGN16, ALIGN32, ALIGN64, ALIGN128, ALIGN256, ALIGN512, ALIGN1024, ALIGN2048, ALIGN4096, ALIGN8192, UNUSED}

for.name: ActualAddr
for.comment: These addresses are the same as in the FuncNameList but are modified in memory.

eval.comment: We need to store the address of the root resource node as many offsets are relative to this.

data.name: Length
data.comment: Number of chars in the string

data.name: Chars
data.comment: Array of Unicode chars (length given in bytes)

data.name: ID
data.domain: { RT_CURSOR=1, RT_BITMAP, RT_ICON, RT_MENU, RT_DIALOG, RT_STRING, RT_FONTDIR, RT_FONT, RT_ACCELERATOR, RT_RCDATA, RT_MESSAGETABLE, RT_GROUP_CURSOR, RT_GROUP_ICON=14, RT_VERSION=16, RT_DLGINCLUDE, RT_PLUGPLAY=19, RT_VXD, RT_ANICURSOR, RT_ANIICON, RT_HTML, RT_MANIFEST }

data.name: Version
data.comment: VerLen rounded up to multiple of 4
Fill bytes to start next byte on DWORD bdry

eval.expr: BlobAddress = addressof(MetadataHeader) + offset, BlobEnd = BlobAddress + size
GuidAddress = addressof(MetadataHeader) + offset, GuidEnd = GuidAddress + size

jump.comment: Peek at the length of the next string
Peek at the length of the next string

data.name: #Blobs
data.comment: All BLOBs are stored in this block

eval.comment: Size of an index into String table (word or dword)
Size of an index into GUID table (word or dword)
Size of an index into Blob table (word or dword)

data.name: valid
data.comment: Bitmask saying which (of 64) tables are present

data.name: sorted
data.comment: Bitmask saying which (of 64) tables are sorted

for.name: TableSize
for.comment: If a table is present save its size

data.name: size
data.comment: Number of rows in the table

eval.expr: MethodRefParentIdxSize = max(max(max(max(TabSize[1], TabSize[2]), TabSize[6]), TabSize[26]), TabSize[27]) > 0x1FFF ? 4 : 2

HasCustomAttributeIdxSize = max(max(max(max(max(TabSize[6], TabSize[4]), max(TabSize[1], TabSize[2])), max(max(TabSize[8], TabSize[9]), max(TabSize[10], TabSize[0]))), max(max(max(TabSize[14], TabSize[23]), max(TabSize[20], TabSize[17])), max(max(TabSize[26], TabSize[27]), max(TabSize[32], TabSize[35])))), max(max(TabSize[38], TabSize[39]),TabSize[40])) > 0x7FF ? 4 : 2

eval.comment: Encoded in 3 bits even though only 2 tables used

for.name: Module
for.comment: This table has only one row representing this module

jump.comment: Start of GUID table is at offset one(1) for some reason

for.name: TypeRef
for.comment: Each row is a referenced class

for.name: TypeDef
for.comment: Each row is a class defined in this module

data.name: FirstMethodDefIdx
data.comment: First method defn for this type

data.name: EntryPoint
data.comment: EntryPointRVA if NATIVE_ENTRYPOINT is set, otherwise EntryPointToken

for.name: dir
for.comment: The number of entries is given by Size minus above 24 bytes. Each entry is 8 bytes.
